application

Class GuiController

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.application.Application
      • application.GuiController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GuiMain

    public class GuiController
extends javafx.application.Application
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    The GuiController contains all the main functionalities for the Bank Teller user interface and can process actions and show errors. It has a three step procedure for the User Interface, which are: 1. Select the action. 2. Fill in the parameters for the holder and account type. 3. State the amount of money to deposit in or withdraw out of the account. Note not all steps are executed based on the action selected. Print commands, for instance, only do Step 1.
    Author:
    Jah C. Speed, Abe Vitangcol

      • actionPaneBackButton

        public void actionPaneBackButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Goes back one step in terms of the actions able to do upon a button click.
        Parameters:

      • backButton

        public void backButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Goes back one step in terms of visuals, updating the user interface when the back button was clicked.
        Parameters:
        event - A button click on the back button.

      • checkBalance

        private int checkBalance()
        Checks if the balance being deposited into an account is valid. An invalid amount is a 0 or negative amount, too little placed in a MoneyMarket account, or simply not a number.
        Returns:
        -1 if an invalid deposit amount was encountered (see above line), 0 otherwise.

      • checkcampusCode

        private int checkcampusCode()
        Checks to see if the loyal input boxes are visible and for the right action. Also capable of catching number format errors for incorrect campus codes.
        Returns:
        -1 if an invalid campus code was encountered, 0 otherwise.

      • checkingAccount

        private Account checkingAccount(Profile profile,
                                double balance)
        Opens a checking account given a starting balance and a profile of the person using it.
        Parameters:
        profile - The identifications of a person (fname, lname, dob) balance The starting amount of money to open the account.
        Returns:
        null if an invalid deposit was made, a duplicate account is in the database, or the account was reopened. The newly created account, newAcc, otherwise.

      • checkLoyal

        private int checkLoyal()
        Checks to see if the loyal input boxes are visible and for the right action. Also capable of catching number format errors for incorrect loyalty codes.
        Returns:
        -1 if an invalid loyalty code was encountered, 0 otherwise.

      • clearAllFields

        private void clearAllFields()
        Clears all typable or selectable fields for the next set of actions. Not only are the fields cleared, but the variables are also set back to its original values of -1 or null.

      • closeAccountCommand

        private Account closeAccountCommand(java.lang.String accountType,
                                    Profile profile)
        Attempts to close an account based on the type to be closed and the person holding the account.
        Parameters:
        accountType - The type of account to be closed. profile The identifications of a person using the account (fname, lname, dob)
        Returns:
        The account that was closed, null otherwise.

      • closeCheckingAccount

        private Account closeCheckingAccount(Profile profile)
        Closes a checking account given a profile.
        Parameters:
        profile - The identifications of the person using the account (fname, lname, dob)
        Returns:
        null if the account was not found in the database The newly created account to find and close otherwise.

      • closeCollegeCheckingAccount

        private Account closeCollegeCheckingAccount(Profile profile)
        Closes a college checking account given a profile.
        Parameters:
        profile - The identifications of the person using the account (fname, lname, dob)
        Returns:
        null if the account was not found in the database The newly created account to find and close otherwise.

      • closeMoneyMarketAccount

        private Account closeMoneyMarketAccount(Profile profile)
        Closes a money market account given a profile.
        Parameters:
        profile - The identifications of the person using the account (fname, lname, dob)
        Returns:
        null if the account was not found in the database The newly created account to find and close otherwise.

      • closeSavingsAccount

        private Account closeSavingsAccount(Profile profile)
        Closes a savings account given a profile.
        Parameters:
        profile - The identifications of the person using the account (fname, lname, dob)
        Returns:
        null if the account was not found in the database The newly created account to find and close otherwise.

      • collageCheckingAccount

        private Account collageCheckingAccount(Profile profile,
                                       double balance,
                                       int code)
        Opens a college checking account given a profile, starting balance, and a campus code.
        Parameters:
        profile - The identifications of a person using the account (fname, lname, dob) balance The starting amount of money to open the account. code The campus code required to open the account. Cannot open the account with a wrong code.
        Returns:
        null if an invalid deposit was made, an invalid campus code was inputed, a duplicate account was found in the database, or the account was reopened. The newly created account, newAcc, otherwise.

      • doAction

        public void doAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Does a specific action based on the choice made from the choice box. After successfully doing the said action, returns back to the default user interface. Will not return back to the default interface if an error was encountered.
        Parameters:
        event - A button click on continue to execute the action.

      • getInfo

        public void getInfo(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Makes more fields visible based on the action done. Any non-print command will go onto step 2 of the GUI and see the fields to input their name, account type, and their date of birth.
        Parameters:
        event - A button click on Select after selecting which action to do.

      • hideAllPanes

        private void hideAllPanes()
        Hides the panes for profile and account information as well as amount to put into the account. Used after completing an action to return to the action selection step of the GUI.

      • initialize

        public void initialize(java.net.URL arg0,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle arg1)
        Initializes the GUI by setting up the choice box, hiding all unnecessary information panes, and initializes the database.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
        Parameters:
        arg0 - arg1

      • isButtonSelected

        private boolean isButtonSelected()
        Checks to see if an account type button was selected or not. Only when applicable, so for opening, closing, withdrawing, or depositing for the account.
        Returns:
        false if a button was not selected, true otherwise.

      • manipluateMoney

        private Account manipluateMoney(java.lang.String accountType,
                                Profile profile,
                                double balance)
        Manipulates money from a specific account with a specific profile and account type.
        Parameters:
        accountType - The type of account to be manipulated from (savings, checking, etc.) profile The identifications of the person using the account (fname, lname, dob) balance The amount of money to to add or subtract from the account.
        Returns:
        null if the balance was invalid or missing in the command or if the account type was invalid. The new account created to find and manipulate from otherwise.

      • moneyMarketAccount

        private Account moneyMarketAccount(Profile profile,
                                   double balance)
        Opens a money market account given a profile and a starting balance.
        Parameters:
        profile - The identifications of a person using the account (fname, lname, dob) balance The starting amount of money to put into the account.
        Returns:
        null if an invalid deposit was made, the balance was not at least $2500 to open, a duplicate account was found in the database, or the account was reopened. The newly created account, newAcc, otherwise.

      • moreInfoNeeded

        public void moreInfoNeeded(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Decides whether more information is needed based on the option selected. Opening is one such action that requires more information. Any action requiring the balance text field will be one that needs more information.
        Parameters:
        event - A button click on the continue button.

      • openAccountCommand

        private Account openAccountCommand(java.lang.String accountType,
                                   Profile profile,
                                   double balance,
                                   int code,
                                   int isLoyal)
        Attempts to open an account based on the params given.
        Parameters:
        accountType - The type of account to be opened. profile The identifications of a person (fname, lname, dob) balance The amount to deposit into the new account. code The campus code for a college checking account, if applicable and necessary. isLoyal A 0 or 1 value stating if the holder is loyal or not. Savings account only.
        Returns:
        The account created based on the accountType given if there are no problems. null otherwise (a problem was encountered in making the account)

      • populateProfile

        private int populateProfile()
        Creates a profile given the name and parameters given in the GUI. Capable of catching errors, such as missing name, missing account type, or invalid birthday.
        Returns:
        -1 if an invalid name is given, if an account type wasn't selected, or if the date of birth is invalid along with an appropriate error message. 0 otherwise.

      • quit

        public void quit()
        Stops running the GUI upon hitting the quit option in the main window.

      • resetToDefault

        private void resetToDefault()
        Goes back to the default look of the GUI, which is a similar look as when the GUI was first opened. Used when one set of actions is completed. Does not reset the drop down menu of the GUI.

      • savingsAccount

        private Account savingsAccount(Profile profile,
                               double balance,
                               int code)
        Opens a savings account given a profile, starting balance, and loyalty code.
        Parameters:
        profile - The identifications of a person using the account (fname, lname, dob) balance The starting amount of money to put into the account. code A number that is either 0 or 1. States if the holder is loyal or not.
        Returns:
        null if an invalid deposit was made, an invalid loyalty code was inputed, a duplicate account was found in the database, or the account was reopened. The newly created account, newAcc, otherwise.

      • selectedAccountType

        public void selectedAccountType(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Sets the account type based on the button selected.
        Parameters:
        event - One of the four buttons clicked on to select.

      • setMoreInfoVisable

        private void setMoreInfoVisable()
        Lets specific fields become visible to be entered to create an account. Deals with Campus Code and Loyal Customer values for college checking accounts and savings accounts, respectively, and hides these fields to make sure that information cannot be filled upon opening a regular account.

      • start

        public void start(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
           throws java.lang.Exception
        Starts and creates the GUI for the Bank Teller, giving it a window area and a title.
        Specified by:
        start in class javafx.application.Application
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
